column7: REA's material topics are data privacy and cyber security, product quality and service, and risk and resilience.

column13: In FY23, REA engaged a sustainability consultancy to assess and benchmark its current sustainable procurement practices in alignment with ISO 20400:2017 Sustainable Procurement. This assessment identified opportunities to embed sustainability into procurement decisions further and mitigate risks from the supply chain to create positive environmental impacts.
column20: Sustainability consultancy, sustainable procurement, procurement decision

column13: REA Group's technology expertise backs Mortgage Choice brokers and has access to more than 35 lenders and thousands of loans via Broker Platform Ã¢ÂÂ REA's proprietary lending system. The Broker Platform records the customer's needs, objectives and financial circumstances to allow the broker to model different lending scenarios.
column20: Broker Platform, broker, lending scenario

column13: In FY23, REA established a Broker Monitoring and Advice team focused on delivering the Broker Monitoring framework, which was enhanced to ensure the expanded broker network continues delivering the highest quality service to customers, which complies with the law and customer's expectations. The enhanced program leverages a data-driven, risk-based approach to monitoring file quality, providing greater compliance visibility concerning regulatory obligations.
column20: Broker Monitoring & Advice team, Broker Monitoring framework, quality service

column13: Generative AI has enormous potential to unlock value for businesses. REA uses AI and Machine Learning to make predictions, classify images, derive market insights, power personalisation and create its Automated Valuation Model (AVM).
column20: Automated Valuation Model, generative AI, market insight

column13: In FY23, REA established a Generative AI Forum dedicated to enabling REA to take advantage of the opportunities Generative AI presents to both enhance its products and data and to drive workforce productivity. The forum seeks to unlock the potential of Generative AI across REA's business in a safe, responsible manner.
column20: Generative AI Forum, generative AI, workforce productivity

column13: REAx is REA's dedicated team focused on innovation and accelerating the creation of next-generation marketplaces. REAx led the re-launch of property.com.au, which is focused on transforming the property research experience.
column20: REAx, innovation, next-generation marketplace

column13: REA's REAio hackathon is dedicated time for its people to explore new ideas, learn and teach. In FY23, REA held two events, bringing together 92 teams and ideas. The focus was on 'Changing the game' to uncover ideas that could disrupt the prop-tech sector and 'Artificial imagination', which provided a testing ground to explore the latest developments in generative AI.
column20: REAio, hackathon, generative AI

column13: REA India's housing.com is known for providing a best-in-class user browsing experience. The website's framework was updated with the latest tech stack, including React 18 and Linaria, to enhance user experience. REA India also completed search results (SRP) and home page migration, which saw a significant improvement in lighthouse scores.
column20: Housing.com, browsing experience, React 18

column13: REA's PropTrack focuses on creating innovative products that make a difference in customers' lives. It includes industry-leading software and apps such as REA's automated valuation model (AVM), one of the first AVM used by each of the big four banks in Australia, as well as the Desktop Valuation Tool, which brings property valuers a whole new way to assess properties. \t
column20: PropTrack, automated valuation model, Desktop Valuation Tool

column13: Accurate property price information is a common need for property seekers globally. REA India launched a new feature to meet this need and inform Indian buyers about property prices. The Price Trend feature showcases price movements in neighbourhoods and projects over 2-3 years.
column20: Price Trend, price information, property seeker

column13: REA India understands that property seekers want an easy and intuitive way to browse properties and enhance their experience. In FY23, REA India introduced curated collections based on user interests, providing a new way to browse properties. One in every five users now explores properties through this option. REA India plans to expand this feature with newer categories, including 'Prime Location', which recommends properties in major city hubs close to schools, hospitals, markets, and office spaces.
column20: Curated collection, property seeker, user interest

column13: REA's Prosper is an online well-being space with curated content to support its customers. It was originally launched in 2022 for struggling property managers during the COVID-19 pandemic. It was expanded in 2023 to benefit the entire property industry, focusing on health, well-being, and long-term prosperity.
column20: Prosper, well-being space, property manager

column13: The Property Panel, consisting of 500+ real estate professionals, is a vital resource for gathering insights on REA's products, services, and industry. This year, REA focused on understanding why agents often overlooked highlighting accessibility features in property listings. A customer poll revealed that nearly half didn't emphasise such features. Through the feedback forum, REA identified various reasons and is working on a solution to encourage agents to utilise accessibility filters to improve the consumer search experience.
column20: The Property Panel, property listing, feedback forum

column13: In FY23, REA launched Property Coach, a human-based service offering on property.com.au. Property Coach helps consumers navigate the buy/sell journey by providing advice on taking the next step, connecting them with the right experts, including real estate agents and mortgage brokers, at the right time and helping to empower more owners to list their properties for sale.
column20: Property Coach, human-based service offering, real estate agent

column13: In June 2023, REA's Mortgage Choice introduced the innovative 'Mortgage Choice Freedom Ã¢ÂÂ powered by Athena' white label product suite. It was developed in collaboration with Athena, a B Corp-certified non-bank lender. Mortgage Choice Freedom rewards clients for paying down their loans. It ensures fair value by eliminating loyalty tax Ã¢ÂÂ ensuring existing customers on a like-for-like loan will always receive the same rates as new customers.
column20: Mortgage Choice Freedom, product suite, loyalty tax

column13: In FY23, REA India introduced the Audience Maximiser Ad Product, responding to customers' needs for retargeting users interested in similar projects. This new offering maximises audience reach through on, and off-platform retargeting and has resulted in over 700 products sold and positive feedback from developer partners.
column20: Audience Maximiser Ad Product, audience, positive feedback

column13: After considering the rapid growth in India's real estate sector and the importance of neighbourhood developments, REA India launched the Locality Guide section. It provides home buyers valuable information on recent developments, benefits, drawbacks, and other neighbourhood insights. Since its launch, over 500,000 users have accessed these neighbourhood insights to decide where to buy.
column20: Locality Guide, real estate sector, neighbourhood

column13: As a digital business, REA works to reduce the carbon footprint of cloud storage. REA and its technology partner, Thoughtworks, are collaborating to implement a Carbon Footprint Backstage Plugin to integrate directly into REA's Developer portal. The plugin will create visibility for development teams to determine how cloud usage impacts the environment and highlight opportunities to reduce the impacts.
column20: Carbon Footprint Backstage Plugin, Thoughtworks, cloud usage

column6: Defined benefit plan obligations and other retirement plans
Ratios of standard entry level wage by gender compared to local minimum wage
Proportion of senior management hired from the local community
Proportion of spending on local suppliers
column13: REA assessed the inherent risk of modern slavery practices in its supply chains. Based on the risk assessment that was completed, REA determined that the inherent risk of modern slavery practices within REA Group's contracted supplier relationships is generally low. This is because REA Group's expenditure is weighted toward lower-risk supplier categories such as technology (software, data and communications), business services and marketing.
column20: Inherent risk, modern slavery, lower-risk supplier

column6: Proportion of spending on local suppliers
column13: REA Group has made available a contact point for concerns or feedback concerning its Supplier Code of Conduct through its central procurement team. Some suppliers have indicated that they will comply with the standards of their analogous code of conduct instead of REA Group's Code. REA Group has not received any notifications from any supplier concerning their inability or refusal to comply with the Supplier Code of Conduct since it was implemented in July 2019.
column20: Contact point, Supplier Code of Conduct, feedback

column6: Operations assessed for risks related to corruption
column13: Every year, REA Australia's legal team runs legal training sessions for all Australian employees. The training covers topics that include privacy and consumer laws and new case law that is relevant to REA's business.
column20: Legal team, legal training, privacy law, consumer law

column6: Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
column13: REA Group prohibits its employees and representatives from engaging in bribery or corruption. REA's anti-bribery and corruption policy (titled "Doing Business Ethically and with Integrity") guides what constitutes bribery or corruption and what steps employees should take if they suspect or become aware of any violations of this policy. Reporting of suspected breaches of the policy is encouraged, including through the whistleblower channels.
column20: Anti-bribery and corruption policy, violation, breach, whistleblower channel

column6: Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
column13: In FY22, REA Australia updated its onboarding training. It launched the 'Living by our Code' annual compliance refresher training, designed to make sure REA continues to maintain the highest level of business ethics and integrity. The training is refreshed every year to ensure that the content is relevant and applicable to all employees.
column20: Living by Our Code, onboarding training, refresher training

column6: Confirmed incidents of corruption and actions taken
Legal actions for anti-competitive behavior, anti-trust, and monopoly practices

column13: REA Group employs strong risk management protocols that apply not only to broader business risks but specifically to tax risks. The tax risk management framework has the purpose of appropriately defining tax positions and providing a framework to outline which tax positions require due consideration from the relevant levels of management, including the ARCC and Board.
column20: Tax risk management framework, tax risk, tax position
